thread.title: Serious crime rate in Canada dropped last year to its lowest level since 1969
thread.title_full: Serious crime rate in Canada dropped last year to its lowest level since 1969 | Toronto Star

title: Serious crime rate in Canada dropped last year to its lowest level since 1969
text:
TORONTO—Serious crime in Canada dropped last year to its lowest level since 1969.
Statistics Canada says police-reported crime relative to the population saw its 11th straight decrease.
In all, police services reported almost 1.8 million crimes in 2014, excluding traffic offences.
That represents a three-per-cent drop from 2013.
The agency attributes the lower rate mostly to fewer break-ins and robberies.
The violent crime rate decreased by 5 per cent in 2014, representing the eighth consecutive annual decline.
Most criminal offences were down between 2013 and 2014, but there were some violations that increased. In particular, rates for the police-reported crimes, excluding traffic, of child pornography (up 41 per cent), terrorism (up 39 per cent), extortion (up 16 per cent), identity fraud (up 8 per cent), sexual violations against children (up 6 per cent) and abduction (up 4 per cent), Statistics Canada reports.
—with files from thestar.com
